DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the patient was pregnant at time of exposure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
